name: openldap
description: OpenLDAP Software is an open source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.
preInstallNotes:
OpenLDAP requires at least 0.3 CPU and 128MB of RAM.

WARNING: OpenLDAP on DCOS is currently in ALPHA. There may be bugs, incomplete
features, incorrect documentation, or other discrepancies.

If you didn't provide a value for `host_volume` when installing the package,
YOUR DATA WILL NOT BE SAVED IN ANY WAY.

This DC/OS OpenLDAP package creates a named Virtual IP for other services in the cluster to access the service in the format `openldap.marathon.l4lb.thisdcos.directory:389` (where `openldap` would be the package name used for installation). It also creates an entry in the External Load Balancer for accessing the service from outside of the cluster on port `10389`.

 You can administer this service easily installing the DC/OS `openldap-admin` package.
postInstallNotes:
OpenLDAP has been installed.i
 Default Login DN: `cn=admin,dc=example,dc=org`
Default password: `admin`
postUninstallNotes: OpenLDAP has been uninstalled. Note that any data persisted to a NFS share still exists and will need to be manually removed.
